description: As a new user, I want to register using my email and verify it with a One-Time Password (OTP) so that I can create a secure account without needing a traditional password. Gherkin scenarios cover successful registration, invalid email, OTP expiration, and resend OTP functionality. Acceptance criteria include email validation, 6-digit OTP generation with 10-minute expiry, rate limiting (max 3 OTPs per 15 minutes), and profile/reward record creation.

As a returning user, I want to sign in using my email and an OTP so that I can access my account securely without remembering a password. Gherkin scenarios cover successful sign-in, unregistered email, invalid OTP, expired OTP, and rate limiting. Acceptance criteria include OTP generation, verification within 10 minutes, max 5 failed attempts before lockout, and JWT token generation.

As a user, I want to view and edit my profile information so that I can keep my account details up to date. Gherkin scenarios cover viewing profile, successful profile updates, and invalid data submission. Acceptance criteria include viewing/editing first name, last name, mobile number, birthday, address fields, and email validation.

As a user, I want to upload a custom avatar image so that I can personalize my profile. Gherkin scenarios cover successful upload, invalid file type/size, and avatar deletion. Acceptance criteria include JPG/PNG/WebP support, 5MB size limit, automatic resizing to 512x512px, secure Supabase storage with RLS policies, and default avatar fallback.

As a system administrator, I want to validate email addresses during registration so that we maintain a clean user database and prevent fraudulent accounts. Gherkin scenarios cover valid email, invalid format, disposable email blocking, and typo suggestions. Acceptance criteria include RFC 5322 validation, disposable domain blocking, typo detection (e.g., gmial.com â†’ gmail.com), and error messaging.

As a demo user, I want to explore the app without providing an email so that I can evaluate features before committing to registration. Gherkin scenarios cover demo session initiation, feature access, data persistence limits, and conversion to full account. Acceptance criteria include session-based authentication, 7-day session expiry, limited cart persistence, and upgrade prompts at checkout.

As a user, I want to set up Passkey authentication (WebAuthn) so that I can log in securely using Face ID, Touch ID, or Windows Hello. Gherkin scenarios cover Passkey registration, successful login, fallback to OTP, and Passkey management. Acceptance criteria include WebAuthn API integration, device-specific credential storage, fallback to OTP, and multiple Passkey support.

summary: SMS OTP as Alternative to Email OTP
description: As a user, I want to receive OTPs via SMS so that I can authenticate using my phone number instead of email. Gherkin scenarios cover SMS OTP for sign-in/registration, invalid phone numbers, and carrier delivery failures. Acceptance criteria include E.164 phone number format, Twilio/AWS SNS integration, 6-digit OTP with 10-minute expiry, and rate limiting (max 3 SMS per 15 minutes).

As a user, I want to sign in using my Google account so that I can access the app quickly without creating a new account. Gherkin scenarios cover first-time Google sign-in with profile creation and returning user sign-in. Acceptance criteria include Supabase Auth Google provider integration, automatic profile creation with Google data, consent screen for permissions, and secure token handling.

As an iOS user, I want to sign in using my Apple ID so that I can authenticate securely with minimal data sharing. Gherkin scenarios cover Apple sign-in, 'Hide My Email' feature handling, and returning user flow. Acceptance criteria include Supabase Auth Apple provider integration, email privacy support, automatic profile creation, and iOS/macOS native prompts.

As a user, I want to sign in using my Facebook account so that I can connect my social profile and streamline registration. Gherkin scenarios cover Facebook sign-in and permission handling. Acceptance criteria include Supabase Auth Facebook provider integration, profile data retrieval (name, email, profile picture), permission request flow, and secure token handling.

As a user, I want to sign in using my Microsoft account so that I can use my work or personal Microsoft credentials. Gherkin scenarios cover Microsoft sign-in and organizational account handling. Acceptance criteria include Supabase Auth Microsoft provider integration, Azure AD support, automatic profile creation, and organizational account compatibility.

As a user, I want a single, intuitive sign-in screen that offers all authentication methods so that I can choose my preferred login option easily. Gherkin scenarios cover authentication options display, method switching, and responsive design. Acceptance criteria include single sign-in/sign-up page, method tabs (Email OTP, SMS OTP, Passkey, Social), visual consistency, mobile responsiveness, and clear error messaging.

As a user with multiple authentication methods, I want to link and manage all my sign-in options so that I can access my account through any preferred method. Gherkin scenarios cover linking accounts, duplicate email handling, unlinking methods, and primary method designation. Acceptance criteria include account linking UI in profile settings, duplicate email detection, minimum one authentication method requirement, and primary method designation.

As a product manager, I want to track authentication method usage and success rates so that I can optimize the authentication experience. Acceptance criteria include tracking authentication attempts by method, success/failure rates, OAuth provider usage, Passkey adoption rate, and session duration metrics with admin dashboard visualization.

summary: Fallback and Error Handling for Authentication
description: As a user, I want clear guidance and fallback options when authentication fails so that I can successfully access my account. Gherkin scenarios cover OAuth provider unavailability, Passkey failure with fallback, SMS delivery failure with email fallback, and network error handling. Acceptance criteria include graceful OAuth provider failure handling, automatic fallback mechanisms, clear error messages, retry logic with exponential backoff, and help center links.

summary: Search for Venues by Name or Location
description: As a user, I want to search for venues by name or location so that I can quickly find a specific place to order from. Gherkin scenarios cover text search by venue name, location-based search, filtering results, and empty results handling. Acceptance criteria include real-time text search, location autocomplete, fuzzy matching, and result sorting by relevance/distance.

summary: Use Current Location to Find Nearby Venues
description: As a user, I want to use my current GPS location to find nearby venues so that I can easily discover places close to me. Gherkin scenarios cover GPS permission request, successful location-based search, permission denial, and location unavailability. Acceptance criteria include GPS location access, geolocation-based venue filtering, distance calculation/sorting, and fallback manual entry.

summary: Display Venue Information in Search Results
description: As a user, I want to see key venue details (name, address, hours, rating) in search results so that I can make informed decisions. Gherkin scenarios cover complete venue info display, missing info handling, and hours/availability indication. Acceptance criteria include venue name, address, rating, review count, distance, hours, categories, and click-to-details navigation.

summary: Select a Venue to Start Shopping
description: As a user, I want to explicitly select a venue from search results so that I can browse its menu and place orders. Gherkin scenarios cover venue selection, confirmation display, menu redirection, and venue persistence. Acceptance criteria include clickable venue cards, selection confirmation, selected venue storage, menu page redirection, and cross-session persistence.

summary: View Currently Selected Venue While Browsing
description: As a user, I want to see which venue is currently selected so that I know where my order will be sent. Gherkin scenarios cover selected venue display, switching confirmation, and no-venue state handling. Acceptance criteria include persistent venue indicator, venue name/address display, accessibility from all pages, and clear change/switch option.

As a user, I want to switch to a different venue so that I can order from another location. Gherkin scenarios cover switching with empty cart, switching with items in cart, cart clearing confirmation, and cart retention on cancel. Acceptance criteria include venue change UI, cart conflict detection, clear warning messages, cart clearing on confirmation, and order-in-progress blocking.

As a user, I want to browse products by category (e.g., Beer, Wine, Spirits, Food) so that I can easily find what I'm looking for. Gherkin scenarios cover category display, selecting a category, filtering by category, and empty category handling. Acceptance criteria include category navigation, product count display, category-filtered results, clear active category indication, and empty state messaging.

As a user, I want to see featured or promoted products so that I can discover popular or special items. Gherkin scenarios cover featured products section display, product details access, and empty featured state. Acceptance criteria include dedicated featured section, visual distinction, product details access, and rotation/dynamic updates.

As a user, I want to view detailed information about a product (name, description, price, alcohol content, allergens) so that I can make informed purchasing decisions. Gherkin scenarios cover complete product details, missing info handling, and allergen warnings. Acceptance criteria include product name, description, price, image, alcohol %, volume, allergen info, and add-to-cart functionality.

summary: Search for Products by Name or Keyword
description: As a user, I want to search for products by typing a name or keyword so that I can quickly find specific items. Gherkin scenarios cover successful search, partial matches, no results, and search result display. Acceptance criteria include real-time search, keyword matching, fuzzy search, result sorting by relevance, and search history.

summary: Filter Products by Category or Tag
description: As a user, I want to filter products by categories or tags (e.g., 'Craft Beer', 'Gluten-Free') so that I can narrow down my options. Gherkin scenarios cover single filter application, filter clearing, and multiple category display. Acceptance criteria include tag cloud/checklist, selectable filters, filtered results display, active filter indication, and clear-all option.

As a user, I want to apply multiple filters at once (e.g., 'Beer' + 'Under $10') so that I can find exactly what I want. Gherkin scenarios cover combining filters, filter removal, and empty results handling. Acceptance criteria include multi-filter selection, combined filter logic (AND), dynamic result updates, and empty state messaging.

As a user, I want to sort products by price (low to high or high to low) so that I can find options within my budget. Gherkin scenarios cover sorting low-to-high, sorting high-to-low, and combining sorting with filters. Acceptance criteria include price sort options, ascending/descending order, sort persistence, and filter compatibility.

summary: Sort Products by Popularity or Name
description: As a user, I want to sort products by popularity or alphabetically so that I can browse efficiently. Gherkin scenarios cover sorting by popularity, sorting alphabetically, and combining with search. Acceptance criteria include popularity/name sort options, sort order indication, default sort logic, and search/filter compatibility.

summary: View Search Results with Relevance Ranking
description: As a user, I want search results to be ranked by relevance so that the most matching products appear first. Gherkin scenarios cover relevance-based ranking, exact vs. partial matches, and ranking clarity. Acceptance criteria include relevance algorithm, exact match prioritization, result scoring display, and keyword highlighting.

summary: Age Verification Modal on First Visit
description: As a first-time visitor, I want to be prompted to verify my age before accessing the app so that legal compliance is maintained. Gherkin scenarios cover modal display, successful verification, underage denial, and skip/close prevention. Acceptance criteria include modal display before content access, DOB entry form, legal age validation, session persistence, and modal blocking.

summary: Collect and Validate Date of Birth
description: As the system, I need to collect and validate the user's date of birth to ensure they meet legal drinking age requirements. Gherkin scenarios cover valid DOB entry, underage user, future date prevention, and invalid format handling. Acceptance criteria include DOB input validation, age calculation, legal age check (21+ in US), error messaging, and format validation.

As the system, I need to verify legal drinking age based on the user's region (e.g., 21 in US, 18 in UK) so that compliance is maintained globally. Gherkin scenarios cover US age check, UK age check, and dynamic age threshold. Acceptance criteria include region-based age thresholds, geolocation or manual selection, configurable age limits, and regional law compliance.

As a verified user, I want my age verification to persist across sessions so that I don't have to re-verify every time. Gherkin scenarios cover session persistence, new session re-verification, and persistent storage. Acceptance criteria include session-based storage, persistent flag for logged-in users, automatic re-check on login, and 30-day guest persistence.

As the system, I need to re-verify age for high-risk actions (e.g., alcohol delivery) even if previously verified, to ensure ongoing compliance. Gherkin scenarios cover re-verification prompt, successful re-verification, and failed re-verification blocking. Acceptance criteria include re-verification triggers, streamlined re-check process, failure blocking, and audit logging.

As the system, I need to block underage users from accessing the app and redirect them to an informational page. Gherkin scenarios cover underage detection, access blocking, and informational page display. Acceptance criteria include underage detection, app access blocking, informational redirect, clear messaging, and no retry mechanism.

As a user, I want to easily view my current rewards points balance so that I can understand my loyalty status at a glance. Gherkin scenarios cover viewing points balance, zero balance display, and recent points activity. Acceptance criteria include prominent points display, balance accuracy, zero balance messaging, and points breakdown link.

As a user, I want to see my current loyalty tier and progress toward the next tier so that I'm motivated to earn more points. Gherkin scenarios cover tier display, progress visualization, and tier benefits access. Acceptance criteria include current tier display, next tier info, visual progress bar, points needed for next tier, and tier benefits description.

summary: Redeem Rewards for Discounts or Free Items
description: As a user, I want to redeem my points for rewards (discounts, free items) so that I can benefit from my loyalty. Gherkin scenarios cover viewing available rewards, successful redemption, insufficient points, and reward application at checkout. Acceptance criteria include rewards catalog, points cost display, redemption confirmation, points deduction, reward expiry, and checkout application.

As a user, I want to automatically earn points from my purchases so that I can build up rewards. Gherkin scenarios cover points earning, bonus points, and points display. Acceptance criteria include automatic points calculation, transaction recording, bonus points rules, real-time balance updates, and points confirmation.

As a user, I want to view my points transaction history so that I can track how I've earned and spent points. Gherkin scenarios cover transaction list display, filtering by type, and empty history handling. Acceptance criteria include chronological transaction list, earn/redeem/expire details, date/amount display, filter options, and pagination.

As a user, I want to refer friends to the app and earn bonus points when they sign up so that I can grow my rewards faster. Gherkin scenarios cover referral code generation, friend sign-up, referrer points award, and referred friend points. Acceptance criteria include unique referral code, shareable link, sign-up tracking, referrer/referee points award, and referral analytics.

As a user, I want to add products to my shopping cart so that I can purchase them later. Gherkin scenarios cover adding an item, adding multiple items, quantity adjustment, and duplicate item handling. Acceptance criteria include add-to-cart button, quantity selector, cart item storage, duplicate consolidation, and confirmation feedback.

As a user, I want to remove items from my cart so that I can change my order. Gherkin scenarios cover single item removal, confirmation prompt, and empty cart handling. Acceptance criteria include remove button, optional confirmation, cart update, empty cart state, and undo option.

As a user, I want to adjust the quantity of items in my cart so that I can order the right amount. Gherkin scenarios cover increasing quantity, decreasing quantity, zero quantity removal, and max quantity handling. Acceptance criteria include quantity controls, minimum 1 unit, automatic removal at zero, max quantity limits, and price updates.

As a user, I want to view a summary of my cart (items, quantities, prices, total) so that I know what I'm ordering. Gherkin scenarios cover cart summary display, price calculation, and empty cart state. Acceptance criteria include item list, quantities, unit/total prices, subtotal, tax, fees, grand total, and empty cart messaging.

As a user, I want to apply discount codes to my cart so that I can save money. Gherkin scenarios cover valid code application, invalid code error, and single code limit. Acceptance criteria include discount code input, code validation, discount application, price update, code removal, and single code enforcement.

As a user, I want to apply promotional codes during checkout so that I can receive special offers. Gherkin scenarios cover promo code entry, successful discount, invalid code, and expired code. Acceptance criteria include promo code field, validation logic, discount calculation, error messaging, and checkout price update.

As a user, I want my cart to be saved across sessions so that I don't lose my selections. Gherkin scenarios cover cart retention on logout, cart retrieval on login, and guest cart persistence. Acceptance criteria include cart storage in database/localStorage, automatic save, cross-session retrieval, 7-day guest persistence, and merge logic on login.

As a user, I want to review my entire order before checking out so that I can confirm everything is correct. Gherkin scenarios cover order summary display, item editing from checkout, and proceeding to payment. Acceptance criteria include order summary page, item details, prices, totals, edit/remove options, and proceed button.

As a user, I want to choose between delivery and pickup so that I can receive my order in the way that suits me. Gherkin scenarios cover delivery selection, pickup selection, and delivery address entry. Acceptance criteria include delivery/pickup toggle, delivery address input, pickup location display, availability validation, and selection persistence.

As a user, I want to enter my payment information securely so that I can complete my purchase safely. Gherkin scenarios cover payment method entry, saved payment selection, and payment validation. Acceptance criteria include secure payment form, PCI compliance, saved methods display, new method option, validation, and encryption.

As a user, I want to see an order confirmation after checkout so that I know my order was successful. Gherkin scenarios cover confirmation page display, order details access, and email confirmation. Acceptance criteria include confirmation page, order number, summary, estimated time, payment receipt, email confirmation, and order tracking link.

summary: Save Payment Method for Future Use
description: As a user, I want to save my payment method during checkout so that future purchases are faster. Gherkin scenarios cover save option, method storage, and default method selection. Acceptance criteria include save checkbox, secure storage, default method option, manage methods link, and PCI compliance.

As a user, I want to apply redeemed rewards during checkout so that I receive my discount. Gherkin scenarios cover reward selection, discount application, and reward expiry handling. Acceptance criteria include available rewards display, reward selection, discount calculation, expiry validation, and applied reward confirmation.

As a guest, I want to checkout without creating an account so that I can make a quick purchase. Gherkin scenarios cover guest info entry, order placement, and account creation prompt. Acceptance criteria include guest checkout option, email/phone entry, order placement, session cart, order tracking via email, and sign-up prompt.

As a user, I want to receive an order confirmation via email or SMS so that I have a record of my purchase. Gherkin scenarios cover email confirmation, SMS confirmation, and confirmation resend. Acceptance criteria include email/SMS send, order details, tracking link, delivery/pickup info, ETA, and resend option.

As a user, I want to view a list of all my past orders so that I can easily keep track of my purchases and spending. Gherkin scenarios cover order history display, order sorting, and empty history state. Acceptance criteria include chronological order list, order date, number, total, status, detail access, and pagination.

As a user, I want to view detailed information about a specific order so that I can see exactly what I purchased. Gherkin scenarios cover order detail page, item breakdown, and payment details. Acceptance criteria include order number, date, status, item list, quantities, prices, subtotal, tax, total, payment method, and delivery/pickup info.

As a user, I want to track my order status in real-time so that I know when it will be ready. Gherkin scenarios cover status display, status updates, and completion notification. Acceptance criteria include order status tracking, real-time updates, status timeline, ETA display, push/email notifications, and status history.

As a user, I want to quickly reorder items from a past order so that I can easily repeat purchases. Gherkin scenarios cover reorder button, cart population, and unavailable item handling. Acceptance criteria include reorder button, cart population, quantity/price updates, unavailable item alerts, and cart review before checkout.

As a user, I want to filter and sort my order history so that I can find specific orders easily. Gherkin scenarios cover filtering by date range, sorting by date/total, and filtering by status. Acceptance criteria include filter options (date, status, venue), sort options (date, total), applied filter indication, and result updates.

As a user, I want to cancel an order if it hasn't been prepared yet so that I can change my mind. Gherkin scenarios cover successful cancellation, cancellation window expiry, and refund processing. Acceptance criteria include cancel button, cancellation window, confirmation prompt, status check, refund processing, and email notification.

As a user, I want to update my email address and phone number so that I receive order updates and can be reached if needed. Gherkin scenarios cover successful update, validation error, and duplicate email prevention. Acceptance criteria include editable email/phone fields, format validation, duplicate detection, update confirmation, and change notification.

As a user, I want to update my birthday and gender so that my profile information is accurate. Gherkin scenarios cover successful update, invalid date prevention, and age verification check. Acceptance criteria include editable birthday/gender fields, date validation, age verification check, optional gender field, and update confirmation.

As a user, I want to add, edit, and delete addresses so that I can manage my delivery locations. Gherkin scenarios cover adding new address, editing existing address, deleting address, and setting default address. Acceptance criteria include address form, validation, CRUD operations, default address option, and address list display.

As a user, I want to control which notifications I receive so that I only get messages relevant to me. Gherkin scenarios cover viewing preferences, toggling notifications, and saving preferences. Acceptance criteria include notification types (order updates, promotions, rewards), toggle controls, preference saving, and default settings.

As a user, I want to opt in or out of marketing emails and SMS so that I control promotional communications. Gherkin scenarios cover opting out of marketing, opting in to marketing, and preference persistence. Acceptance criteria include marketing opt-in/out toggles, email/SMS preferences, CAN-SPAM compliance, preference saving, and unsubscribe link.

As a user, I want to manage my privacy settings including data sharing and cookie preferences so that I control my personal data. Gherkin scenarios cover data sharing preferences, cookie settings, and privacy preference saving. Acceptance criteria include data sharing toggles, cookie consent management, privacy policy link, GDPR/CCPA compliance, and preference persistence.

As a user, I want to review and manage all consents I've given (e.g., terms of service, data processing) so that I maintain control over my data. Gherkin scenarios cover viewing consents, withdrawing consent, and re-granting consent. Acceptance criteria include consent list, withdrawal option, re-grant option, consent history, and legal compliance.

As the system, I need to validate all profile data before saving to ensure data integrity and security. Gherkin scenarios cover valid data submission, invalid email format, and invalid phone format. Acceptance criteria include field validation, format checks, required field enforcement, error messaging, and duplicate detection.

As a user, I want to add new payment methods securely so I can easily make purchases without re-entering details every time. Gherkin scenarios cover successful card addition, invalid card rejection, and duplicate card prevention. Acceptance criteria include secure payment form, PCI compliance, Stripe tokenization, card validation, duplicate detection, and confirmation message.

As a user, I want to set a default payment method so that checkout is faster. Gherkin scenarios cover setting default method, default auto-selection, and changing default. Acceptance criteria include default toggle, auto-selection at checkout, visual indication, and update confirmation.

As a user, I want to update payment method details (e.g., expiry date, billing address) so that my information stays current. Gherkin scenarios cover successful update, invalid data rejection, and Stripe update handling. Acceptance criteria include edit option, field updates, validation, Stripe sync, and update confirmation.

As a user, I want to view a history of my payments so I can track my transactions and identify any discrepancies. Gherkin scenarios cover viewing transaction history, filtering by date, and viewing transaction details. Acceptance criteria include chronological list, date/amount/order display, filter/sort options, detail access, and pagination.

As the system, I need to ensure all payment data handling complies with PCI DSS standards to protect user financial information. Acceptance criteria include PCI DSS compliance, no storage of sensitive card data, Stripe tokenization, secure data transmission, regular security audits, and compliance documentation.

As a user, I want to view my spending patterns over time (e.g., weekly, monthly) so I can understand my consumption habits and manage my budget effectively. Gherkin scenarios cover spending graph display, time period filtering, and category breakdown. Acceptance criteria include spending visualization, time period filters, category breakdown, total spending display, and export option.

As a user, I want to analyze how often I place orders so that I can track my ordering habits. Gherkin scenarios cover order frequency display, time period selection, and trend visualization. Acceptance criteria include frequency metrics, trend graphs, time period filters, average order value, and peak period identification.

summary: View Loyalty Points Earned and Redeemed
description: As a user, I want to see how many points I've earned and redeemed over time so that I can track my loyalty program participation. Gherkin scenarios cover points analytics display, points breakdown, and time period filtering. Acceptance criteria include points earned/redeemed charts, time period filters, transaction breakdown, trend analysis, and points balance.

As a user, I want to receive personalized insights about my spending and recommendations so that I can make better decisions. Gherkin scenarios cover insights display, recommendation generation, and insight dismissal. Acceptance criteria include personalized insights, spending recommendations, budget alerts, savings opportunities, and insight customization.

As a user, I want to export my dashboard data in CSV or PDF format so that I can keep records or share with others. Gherkin scenarios cover CSV export, PDF export, and export customization. Acceptance criteria include export buttons, CSV/PDF formats, data completeness, date range selection, and download confirmation.

As a user, I want to compare my spending and ordering patterns across different time periods so that I can identify trends. Gherkin scenarios cover period comparison, trend identification, and comparison visualization. Acceptance criteria include comparison mode, multiple period selection, side-by-side visualization, trend indicators, and export comparison.

summary: Set Up Biometric Authentication (Face ID & Touch ID)
description: As a user, I want to set up biometric authentication (Face ID, Touch ID) so that I can log in securely and conveniently. Gherkin scenarios cover biometric enrollment, successful setup, device incompatibility, and biometric preference saving. Acceptance criteria include biometric enrollment flow, Face ID/Touch ID support, device compatibility check, preference persistence, and confirmation message.

As a user, I want to disable biometric authentication so that I can revert to password/OTP login if needed. Gherkin scenarios cover successful disabling, confirmation prompt, and fallback verification. Acceptance criteria include disable option, confirmation prompt, biometric removal, fallback to password/OTP, and preference update.

summary: Manage Biometric Preferences (When to Use Biometrics)
description: As a user, I want to customize when biometric authentication is required (e.g., login only vs. login + payment) so that I have control over security levels. Gherkin scenarios cover preference customization, preference saving, and preference application. Acceptance criteria include preference options, login/payment toggles, preference persistence, and immediate effect.

summary: Fallback to Password/OTP if Biometrics Fail
description: As a user, I want to fall back to password or OTP authentication if biometric authentication fails so that I can still access my account. Gherkin scenarios cover biometric failure, fallback prompt, and successful OTP login. Acceptance criteria include biometric failure detection, automatic fallback prompt, OTP/password option, clear instructions, and retry option.

As a user, I want to register multiple biometric credentials (e.g., different fingers, faces) so that I have flexible authentication options. Gherkin scenarios cover adding additional biometric, multiple credentials display, and credential removal. Acceptance criteria include multiple credential support, enrollment for each, credential list display, and individual removal.

As a user, I want to view a log of biometric authentication attempts so that I can monitor my account security. Gherkin scenarios cover audit log display, successful/failed attempts, and log filtering. Acceptance criteria include authentication log, date/time/device info, success/failure status, filter options, and retention period.

As a user, I want to see my estimated Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) in real-time so that I can monitor my sobriety. Gherkin scenarios cover BAC display, BAC calculation update, and zero BAC state. Acceptance criteria include BAC percentage display, real-time updates, BAC calculation algorithm, visual indicators, and safety thresholds.

As a user, I want to manually log drinks so that the BAC estimation is accurate. Gherkin scenarios cover drink logging, drink type selection, and log editing. Acceptance criteria include drink log form, drink type/volume/alcohol % selection, timestamp recording, BAC recalculation, and log history.

summary: Receive Safety Alerts Based on BAC Levels
description: As a user, I want to receive safety alerts when my BAC reaches certain thresholds so that I can make responsible decisions. Gherkin scenarios cover low-level alert, high-level alert, and critical alert with intervention. Acceptance criteria include BAC threshold alerts, multi-level warnings, actionable recommendations, push/in-app notifications, and alert history.

summary: Connect Wearable Devices for Biometric Monitoring
description: As a user, I want to connect wearable devices (e.g., Apple Watch, Fitbit) to track biometric data for more accurate BAC estimation. Gherkin scenarios cover device connection, biometric sync, and device disconnection. Acceptance criteria include wearable device integration, heart rate/temp sync, BAC calculation enhancement, device list display, and disconnect option.

As a user, I want to view responsible drinking tips and resources so that I can stay informed about safe drinking practices. Gherkin scenarios cover tips display, tip categories, and resource links. Acceptance criteria include tips section, categorized content, external resource links, regular updates, and accessibility.

As a user, I want to end my drinking session to reset my BAC tracking and finalize session data. Gherkin scenarios cover session end, session summary, and auto-end after inactivity. Acceptance criteria include end session button, session summary, BAC reset, session archiving, and auto-end after 6 hours.

As a user, I want to add a payment method securely via Stripe so that I can make purchases easily. Gherkin scenarios cover successful Stripe payment method addition, tokenization failure, and duplicate method prevention. Acceptance criteria include Stripe Elements integration, tokenization, PCI compliance, method storage, duplicate detection, and confirmation.

As a user, I want to view all my saved payment methods so that I can manage them easily. Gherkin scenarios cover payment method list display, default method indication, and empty state handling. Acceptance criteria include method list display, card details (last 4 digits, expiry), default indication, and add method option.

As a user, I want to remove a saved payment method so that I can clean up unused methods. Gherkin scenarios cover successful removal, default method protection, and removal confirmation. Acceptance criteria include remove button, confirmation prompt, default method protection, Stripe detachment, and list update.

summary: Process Payment Securely via Stripe PaymentIntent
description: As a user, I want my payments to be processed securely via Stripe PaymentIntent so that my transactions are safe. Gherkin scenarios cover successful payment processing, payment failure, and 3D Secure authentication. Acceptance criteria include PaymentIntent creation, 3D Secure support, payment confirmation, receipt generation, and error handling.

As a user, I want clear guidance when a payment fails so that I can resolve the issue and retry. Gherkin scenarios cover payment decline, insufficient funds, and retry after fixing. Acceptance criteria include failure detection, clear error messages, retry option, alternative method suggestion, and support link.

As a user, I want to receive refunds for canceled orders via Stripe so that I get my money back. Gherkin scenarios cover full refund processing, partial refund, and refund notification. Acceptance criteria include refund initiation, full/partial refund support, Stripe Refund API, processing time notification, and email confirmation.

summary: Handle Stripe Webhooks for Payment Events
description: As the system, I need to handle Stripe webhooks to process payment events (success, failure, disputes) in real-time. Acceptance criteria include webhook endpoint, signature verification, event handling (payment_intent.succeeded, payment_intent.payment_failed, charge.dispute.created), idempotency, retry logic, and logging.

As a user, I want to subscribe to recurring services and have payments processed automatically via Stripe. Gherkin scenarios cover subscription creation, automatic renewal, and cancellation. Acceptance criteria include Stripe Subscription API, plan selection, automatic billing, subscription management, and email notifications.

As an admin, I want to view payment analytics (transaction volume, success rates, revenue) so that I can monitor business performance. Acceptance criteria include analytics dashboard, transaction volume, success/failure rates, revenue metrics, refund tracking, and data export.

As a visitor, I want to accept or decline cookie consent so that I control how my data is tracked. Gherkin scenarios cover cookie banner display, accepting all cookies, declining non-essential cookies, and preference saving. Acceptance criteria include cookie banner, accept/decline options, cookie categorization, preference persistence, and re-consent prompt.

As a user, I want to manage my cookie preferences (essential, functional, analytics, marketing) so that I have granular control. Gherkin scenarios cover viewing preferences, customizing categories, and saving preferences. Acceptance criteria include cookie settings page, category toggles, essential cookies always-on, preference saving, and re-consent option.

As a user, I want to request an export of all my personal data so that I can review what information is stored about me. Gherkin scenarios cover data export request, export file generation, and download access. Acceptance criteria include export request form, GDPR/CCPA compliance, data compilation (profile, orders, payments, consents), JSON/CSV format, email notification, and 30-day access.

summary: Request Data Deletion (Right to be Forgotten)
description: As a user, I want to request deletion of my personal data so that I can exercise my right to be forgotten. Gherkin scenarios cover deletion request, account deactivation, and deletion confirmation. Acceptance criteria include deletion request form, confirmation prompt, account deactivation, data anonymization, 30-day retention period, and deletion confirmation email.

As a user, I want to view the privacy policy so that I understand how my data is used. Gherkin scenarios cover policy access, policy updates, and version history. Acceptance criteria include privacy policy page, plain language, data usage explanation, update notifications, and version history.

As a user, I want to view the terms of service so that I understand the rules and agreements. Gherkin scenarios cover terms access and acceptance requirement. Acceptance criteria include terms page, clear language, acceptance requirement on signup, update notifications, and version history.

As a user, I want to control how my data is shared with third parties so that I maintain privacy. Gherkin scenarios cover viewing sharing preferences, opting out of sharing, and saving preferences. Acceptance criteria include data sharing settings, third-party list, opt-in/opt-out toggles, preference persistence, and GDPR/CCPA compliance.

As a user, I want to view a log of security-related activities (logins, password changes) so that I can monitor my account. Gherkin scenarios cover audit log access, activity filtering, and suspicious activity detection. Acceptance criteria include audit log page, activity types (login, password change, payment method update), date/time/device info, filter options, and suspicious activity alerts.

As a user, I want to report data privacy concerns or breaches so that issues can be addressed. Gherkin scenarios cover concern submission, acknowledgment, and resolution update. Acceptance criteria include privacy concern form, issue categorization, submission confirmation, acknowledgment email, and resolution tracking.

As a venue owner, I want to view a landing page explaining the partnership program so that I can learn about the benefits. Gherkin scenarios cover landing page access, benefits display, and CTA navigation. Acceptance criteria include partnership landing page, benefits section, testimonials, CTA buttons, and responsive design.

As a venue owner, I want to see detailed benefits and features of partnering so that I can make an informed decision. Gherkin scenarios cover benefits display, feature comparison, and pricing transparency. Acceptance criteria include benefits list, feature comparison table, pricing info, ROI examples, and visual aids.

As a venue owner, I want to submit an inquiry to learn more about partnering so that I can start the onboarding process. Gherkin scenarios cover successful form submission, validation error handling, and confirmation email. Acceptance criteria include inquiry form (venue name, contact, location, interest), field validation, submission confirmation, and email acknowledgment.

As a venue owner, I want to view detailed program information (onboarding, support, marketing) so that I understand what's involved. Gherkin scenarios cover program details access and FAQ navigation. Acceptance criteria include program details page, onboarding steps, support info, marketing resources, FAQs, and contact info.

As a venue owner, I want to receive confirmation after submitting an inquiry so that I know my request was received. Gherkin scenarios cover email confirmation, confirmation page display, and follow-up timeline. Acceptance criteria include confirmation email, inquiry summary, next steps, timeline, and contact info.

As an admin, I want to track and manage partnership leads so that I can follow up effectively. Acceptance criteria include admin dashboard, lead list, status tracking, assignment, notes, and follow-up reminders.

As a user, I want to create a buddy list of friends so that I can easily assign drinks to them in group orders. Gherkin scenarios cover adding buddies, buddy confirmation, and buddy list display. Acceptance criteria include buddy management UI, add/remove buddies, buddy confirmation, buddy list display, and search functionality.

As a user, I want to assign drinks to my buddies when adding items to the cart so that I can order for my friends. Gherkin scenarios cover drink assignment, assignment display, and reassignment. Acceptance criteria include assignment UI, buddy selection, assignment confirmation, visual indication, and edit option.

As a buddy, I want to accept or decline drinks assigned to me so that I control what I consume. Gherkin scenarios cover drink acceptance, drink decline, and notification. Acceptance criteria include assignment notification, accept/decline options, response tracking, notification to assigner, and expiry (15 minutes).

summary: Integrate Assigned Drinks into Sobriety Monitor
description: As a user, I want accepted assigned drinks to be tracked in my sobriety monitor so that my BAC estimation is accurate. Gherkin scenarios cover drink tracking, BAC update, and alert triggering. Acceptance criteria include automatic drink logging, BAC recalculation, sobriety monitor integration, and safety alerts.

As a user, I want to create a group order for multiple people so that we can order together. Gherkin scenarios cover group order creation, buddy invitation, and order coordination. Acceptance criteria include group order UI, buddy selection, invitation sending, order consolidation, and group summary.

As a user, I want to split payment for group orders so that everyone pays their share. Gherkin scenarios cover payment splitting, individual payment, and payment confirmation. Acceptance criteria include split payment UI, itemized breakdown, individual payment processing, payment tracking, and completion notification.

As a user, I want to view my group order history so that I can track past group purchases. Gherkin scenarios cover group order list display, order details access, and buddy identification. Acceptance criteria include group order list, order details, buddy names, payment split, and filter options.

As a user, I want to receive real-time AI-powered safety recommendations based on my BAC so that I can make responsible decisions. Gherkin scenarios cover safety recommendation display, personalized advice, and recommendation dismissal. Acceptance criteria include AI-generated recommendations, BAC-based advice, alternative suggestions, real-time updates, and user dismissal.

As a user, I want to receive predictive BAC alerts before I reach unsafe levels so that I can pace myself. Gherkin scenarios cover predictive alert display, alert customization, and alert acknowledgment. Acceptance criteria include predictive algorithm, early warning alerts, customizable thresholds, visual/audio notifications, and acknowledgment tracking.

As a user, I want AI-suggested intervention strategies when my BAC is high so that I can sober up safely. Gherkin scenarios cover intervention suggestion, resource provision, and intervention tracking. Acceptance criteria include AI-generated interventions, food/water suggestions, rest recommendations, ride-sharing links, and effectiveness tracking.

As a user, I want emergency notifications sent to my emergency contacts if my BAC reaches critical levels so that I get help. Gherkin scenarios cover emergency alert triggering, contact notification, and location sharing. Acceptance criteria include critical BAC threshold, emergency contact notification, location sharing, automated messaging, and user override.

As an admin, I want to track the effectiveness of AI sobriety recommendations so that we can improve the system. Acceptance criteria include effectiveness metrics, user engagement tracking, BAC reduction correlation, feedback collection, and recommendation optimization.

summary: Use Voice Commands to Browse Menu
description: As a user, I want to browse the menu using voice commands so that I can order hands-free. Gherkin scenarios cover voice browsing activation, category navigation, and product selection. Acceptance criteria include voice activation, natural language processing, menu navigation, product details, and voice feedback.

summary: Add Items to Cart via Voice
description: As a user, I want to add items to my cart using voice commands so that I can build an order hands-free. Gherkin scenarios cover voice add-to-cart, quantity specification, and cart confirmation. Acceptance criteria include voice add command, quantity recognition, cart update, voice confirmation, and error correction.

As a user, I want to complete checkout using voice commands so that I can finalize my order hands-free. Gherkin scenarios cover voice checkout initiation, payment confirmation, and order placement. Acceptance criteria include voice checkout command, order summary, payment confirmation, voice authentication, and order confirmation.

As a user, I want to search for products using voice commands so that I can find items quickly. Gherkin scenarios cover voice search activation, query recognition, and result display. Acceptance criteria include voice search activation, natural language query, search result display, voice result readout, and visual fallback.

As a user with accessibility needs, I want voice-activated features so that I can use the app without touch input. Gherkin scenarios cover accessibility mode activation, navigation assistance, and voice feedback. Acceptance criteria include accessibility mode, full voice navigation, screen reader integration, voice feedback, and customization.

As a multilingual user, I want voice commands to support my preferred language so that I can order in my native language. Gherkin scenarios cover language selection, multilingual voice recognition, and language switching. Acceptance criteria include language selection, multi-language support, accent recognition, language switching, and translation.

As a user, I want to create an allergen profile listing my allergies so that the app can warn me about unsafe products. Gherkin scenarios cover profile creation, allergen selection, and severity indication. Acceptance criteria include allergen profile UI, allergen list, severity levels, profile saving, and edit option.

As a user, I want to receive real-time warnings when viewing products containing my allergens so that I can avoid them. Gherkin scenarios cover allergen detection, warning display, and warning acknowledgment. Acceptance criteria include allergen scanning, real-time warnings, visual alerts, severity-based messaging, and acknowledgment.

As a user, I want AI-suggested alternatives when a product contains my allergens so that I can find safe options. Gherkin scenarios cover alternative suggestion, safe product display, and alternative selection. Acceptance criteria include AI-generated alternatives, allergen-free options, visual display, similarity matching, and easy selection.

As a user, I want to be warned about potential cross-contamination risks so that I can make informed decisions. Gherkin scenarios cover cross-contamination detection, warning display, and risk explanation. Acceptance criteria include cross-contamination scanning, risk level indication, detailed explanations, source identification, and acknowledgment.

As a user, I want to track my allergen exposure history so that I can identify patterns. Gherkin scenarios cover exposure log display, incident recording, and pattern analysis. Acceptance criteria include exposure log, incident details, pattern detection, visual analytics, and export option.

As a user, I want AI-powered venue recommendations based on my preferences so that I discover great places. Gherkin scenarios cover recommendation display, preference learning, and recommendation feedback. Acceptance criteria include AI recommendations, preference-based matching, collaborative filtering, visual display, and feedback collection.

As a user, I want venue suggestions based on the occasion (date night, sports game, happy hour) so that I find the perfect spot. Gherkin scenarios cover occasion selection, suggestion display, and occasion customization. Acceptance criteria include occasion types, context-aware suggestions, AI matching, visual display, and custom occasion creation.

summary: Match Venues Based on Social Group Preferences
description: As a user, I want venue suggestions that match my social group's preferences so that everyone is happy. Gherkin scenarios cover group preference input, venue matching, and group consensus. Acceptance criteria include group selection, preference aggregation, AI matching, consensus scoring, and suggestion display.

summary: View Real-Time Venue Availability and Wait Times
description: As a user, I want to see real-time venue availability and wait times so that I can choose accordingly. Gherkin scenarios cover availability display, wait time estimation, and live updates. Acceptance criteria include real-time data, availability status, wait time estimates, live updates, and alternative suggestions.

As a user, I want venues ranked based on my personal preferences so that the best matches appear first. Gherkin scenarios cover ranking display, ranking explanation, and ranking customization. Acceptance criteria include personalized ranking algorithm, preference weighting, ranking scores, explanation, and customization.

summary: Coordinate Group Order with AI Assistant
description: As a user, I want an AI assistant to help coordinate group orders so that everyone gets what they want. Gherkin scenarios cover AI coordination initiation, preference collection, and order consolidation. Acceptance criteria include AI assistant UI, preference collection, conflict resolution, order consolidation, and confirmation.

As a user, I want AI to resolve conflicting preferences in group orders so that we reach consensus. Gherkin scenarios cover conflict detection, AI resolution suggestion, and consensus display. Acceptance criteria include conflict detection, AI-generated compromises, voting options, consensus tracking, and final decision.

summary: Optimize Group Order Budget with AI
description: As a user, I want AI to help optimize our group order budget so that we stay within spending limits. Gherkin scenarios cover budget input, AI optimization, and budget tracking. Acceptance criteria include budget input, AI cost optimization, alternative suggestions, real-time tracking, and budget alerts.

As a user, I want AI to coordinate timing for group orders so that everyone's orders arrive together. Gherkin scenarios cover timing coordination, preparation time estimation, and synchronized delivery. Acceptance criteria include timing coordination, prep time estimation, synchronized ordering, delivery scheduling, and timing notifications.

summary: Accommodate Dietary Restrictions in Group Orders
description: As a user, I want AI to ensure dietary restrictions are accommodated in group orders so that everyone can eat safely. Gherkin scenarios cover dietary restriction input, AI accommodation, and restriction verification. Acceptance criteria include dietary restriction collection, AI filtering, safe options display, restriction verification, and allergen warnings.

As a user, I want AI-powered insights into my spending patterns so that I understand my habits. Gherkin scenarios cover insights display, pattern recognition, and insight customization. Acceptance criteria include AI spending analysis, pattern detection, visual insights, trend identification, and customization.

As a user, I want AI to automatically categorize my spending so that I can track expenses by category. Gherkin scenarios cover auto-categorization, category display, and manual adjustment. Acceptance criteria include AI categorization, spending categories, visual breakdown, manual override, and category history.

As a user, I want AI to alert me when I'm approaching budget limits and suggest adjustments. Gherkin scenarios cover budget setup, AI monitoring, and alert triggering. Acceptance criteria include budget configuration, AI monitoring, threshold alerts, spending recommendations, and alert customization.

summary: Track Tax and Expense for Reporting
description: As a user, I want AI to track tax and expenses for easy reporting so that I can file accurately. Gherkin scenarios cover tax tracking, expense reporting, and report generation. Acceptance criteria include tax calculation, expense categorization, AI report generation, export formats, and tax year organization.

As a user, I want AI to forecast my future spending based on patterns so that I can plan ahead. Gherkin scenarios cover forecast display, forecast accuracy, and forecast adjustment. Acceptance criteria include AI forecasting, trend-based predictions, visual forecasts, accuracy metrics, and scenario planning.
